Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class SCCPasswordHash

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.securecryptoconfig.SCCPasswordHash
  • public class SCCPasswordHash
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a container for a cryptographic Password Hash.

    SCCPasswordHash contains a byte[] representation of a COSE message. The byte[] contains the password hash as well as all the parameters used during hashing. The inclusion of the used parameters in the password hash ensures that validation implementation code does not need to know the used algorithm or parameters before validation, but can parse it from the COSE message.

    A new SCCPasswordHash can be created by calling SecureCryptoConfig.passwordHash(byte[]).
    E.g. 
     {
        @code
        SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
        SCCPasswordHash passwordHash = scc.passwordHash(password);
 }
    Alternatively it is also possible to create a SCCPasswordHash from a existing byte[] representation of a SCCPaswordHash by calling createFromExistingPasswordHash(byte[])

      • validatePasswordHash

        public boolean validatePasswordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface password)
                             throws SCCException
        Validate if SCCPasswordHash matches hash of a given password. The password will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        SCCException
